content.text: Strawberries cost \(4.20 per kilogram and cream costs\) 8.56 per litre

He then gives \(\frac{3}{7}\) of the biscuits that are left to his cousin

content.text: Write down the probability that a marble picked at random from bag \(A\) is black
Toby says,
'You are more likely to pick a black marble at random from bag \(B\) than from bag \(A\) because bag \(B\) has more black marbles.'
Is Toby correct?
Give a reason for your answer
Toby adds some marbles to bag \(B\)
The probability of picking a black marble at random from either bag is now the same
Work out the smallest number of black marbles and white marbles he adds to bag \(B\)
Black
Bag \(A\) contains 2 black marbles and 3 white marbles
Bag \(B\) contains 5 black marbles and 8 white marbles

Trains will travel the \(36\mathrm{km}\) at an average speed of \(75\mathrm{km / h}\)
Work out the journey time
Give your answer in minutes
